stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Spear Phishing Email with Changed Email Theme Contains Malicious Link
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 18 March 2015, a U.S. Government agency received a spear-phishing email sent from a spoofed sender with the subject "my new email address!" The email included a malicious link to the domain pics.toprivatespace.net

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
An HTML image tag will be requested automatically when the email is viewed in HTML mode and likely used to notify the attacker if a targeted individual viewed the email.
---START EMAIL BODY---- All group members, This is [REDACTED] I just want to inform you that I changed my email address. You can update with this new one. Refer to http://pics.toprivatespace.net/photos/group/20157736.php?id=[UNIQUE 5 DIGIT NUMBER] for the photo of last gathering. Wish you have a good day! [REDACTED] ---END EMAIL BODY----

This link will direct the intended recipient to a malicious file, exploit, or credential harvester. The number at the end of the link may vary depending on the target. The link likely connects to a malicious website.
The domain pics.toprivatespace.net was previously reported in IB-15-10127.
